SENT.plain: Significant prolongation of the QT interval in pediatric patients with cardiomyopathy is rare
We report two cases of dilated myopathy with transient and dramatic QT prolongation
Both had associated ventricular arrhythmias, with one having torsade de pointes, and the other nonsustained ventricular tachycardia
Normalization of their QTc occurred as their ventricular function improved
